headline: Teledyne Reveals FLIR MIX Multispectral Infrared Imaging Systems
summary: TDY presents FLIR MIX Starter Kits, an enhanced multispectral imaging system intended to increase the precision and detail of infrared imaging.

content.title: Teledyne Reveals FLIR MIX Multispectral Infrared Imaging Systems
content.summary: TDY presents FLIR MIX Starter Kits, an enhanced multispectral imaging system intended to increase the precision and detail of infrared imaging.

headline: Teledyne FLIR Defense Awarded $74.2M Contract for U.S. Army’s Next-Gen Nuclear, Biological and Chemical Reconnaissance Vehicle Sensor Suite Upgrade
summary: BOSTON, April 09, 2025--Teledyne FLIR Defense, part of Teledyne Technologies Incorporated (NYSE:TDY), announced it has been awarded a four year, $74.2 million contract by the U.S. Army for continued development of the next-generation mounted reconnaissance capability for the M1135 Stryker’s Nuclear, Biological and Chemical Reconnaissance Vehicle (NBCRV) Sensor Suite Upgrade Program.

content.title: Teledyne FLIR Defense Awarded $74.2M Contract for U.S. Army’s Next-Gen Nuclear, Biological and Chemical Reconnaissance Vehicle Sensor Suite Upgrade
content.summary: BOSTON, April 09, 2025--Teledyne FLIR Defense, part of Teledyne Technologies Incorporated (NYSE:TDY), announced it has been awarded a four year, $74.2 million contract by the U.S. Army for continued development of the next-generation mounted reconnaissance capability for the M1135 Stryker’s Nuclear, Biological and Chemical Reconnaissance Vehicle (NBCRV) Sensor Suite Upgrade Program.

thumbnail.caption: Teledyne FLIR Defense has been awarded a four year, $74.2 million contract by the U.S. Army for continued development of the next-generation mounted reconnaissance capability for the M1135 Stryker’s Nuclear, Biological and Chemical Reconnaissance Vehicle (NBCRV) Sensor Suite Upgrade Program. FLIR Defense is lead integrator in modernizing the NBCRV sensor suite system with an improved and autonomous suite of chemical, biological, radiological and nuclear (CBRN) sensors. Among other third-party solutions, the Sensor Suite features the FLIR Defense R80D SkyRaider™ drone integrated with FLIR’s MUVE™ B330 biological detection payload designed for small unmanned aerial systems. Also, a FLIR-developed command and control system combines all devices and platforms with sensor fusion and automation features that reduce cognitive burden and improve decision-making. (Photo by: Vashelle Nino)
